description: Comprehensive geometry course covering foundational concepts, reasoning, proof, congruence, similarity, polygons, circles, right triangles, trigonometry, transformations, area, perimeter, and 3D solids. Designed to prepare students for advanced math courses and standardized assessments.

topics.name: Unit 1: Foundations of Geometry
topics.description: Points, lines, planes, segments, angles, basic geometric definitions, postulates, and reasoning skills.

topics.name: Unit 2: Reasoning and Proof
topics.description: Logic, conditional statements, deductive reasoning, proof strategies, and two-column proofs.

topics.name: Unit 3: Parallel and Perpendicular Lines
topics.description: Properties of parallel and perpendicular lines, angle relationships, transversal lines, and slope applications.

topics.name: Unit 4: Triangles and Congruence
topics.description: Triangle classification, congruence postulates, properties, and triangle inequality.

topics.name: Unit 5: Relationships in Triangles
topics.description: Pythagorean theorem, special right triangles, triangle centers, midsegments, and angle bisectors.

topics.name: Unit 6: Polygons and Quadrilaterals
topics.description: Polygon properties, interior/exterior angles, special quadrilaterals, and diagonals.

topics.name: Unit 7: Similarity
topics.description: Ratio and proportion, similar triangles, scale factors, and applications in geometric modeling.

topics.name: Unit 8: Right Triangles and Trigonometry
topics.description: Trigonometric ratios, solving right triangles, special right triangles, and applications in real-world problems.

topics.name: Unit 9: Circles
topics.description: Circle terminology, arcs, chords, tangents, central and inscribed angles, and circumference calculations.

topics.name: Unit 10: Area and Perimeter
topics.description: Area and perimeter formulas for polygons, circles, and composite figures.

topics.name: Unit 11: Surface Area and Volume of Solids
topics.description: Surface area and volume calculations for prisms, cylinders, pyramids, cones, spheres, and composite solids.

topics.name: Unit 12: Transformations and Review
topics.description: Translations, reflections, rotations, dilations, symmetry, and cumulative review of geometry concepts.
